skill.name: quality-reviewer
skill.description: Automatically reviews DevPrep AI code for quality standards including ESLint compliance, TypeScript strict mode, 180-line file limits, complexity under 15, proper naming conventions, import patterns, and architectural compliance with the 6-folder structure
skill.summary: Automatically reviews DevPrep AI code for quality standards including ESLint compliance, TypeScript ...
skill.author: ArieGoldkin

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate code quality review skill. The 262 static findings are all false positives: markdown backticks flagged as shell commands, example bad code showing what NOT to do, and documentation about deprecated practices. The actual bash scripts only run standard dev tools (npm, grep, find, wc) scoped to frontend/src. No network calls to external endpoints, no credential access, and no persistence mechanisms.

content.value_statement: Manual code reviews take time and miss issues. This skill runs 7 automated checks for file size, complexity, naming, imports, architecture, ESLint, and TypeScript compliance with DevPrep AI standards.
actual_capabilities: Check file size limits (180 lines maximum per file)
Verify cyclomatic complexity under 15 per function
Validate TypeScript naming conventions with I prefix for interfaces
Detect incorrect import patterns requiring path aliases
Run ESLint and TypeScript compiler checks
limitations: Designed specifically for DevPrep AI project structure
Only scans TypeScript and TSX files in frontend/src directory
Requires npm and npx to be available in PATH

best_practices: Run full reviews before committing to catch all issues at once
Address violations incrementally when learning the standards
Use specific checks (check-file-size, check-naming) for focused feedback
anti_patterns: Ignoring violations and pushing code anyway
Running only one check when multiple standards are likely violated

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It uses Bash, Read, Grep, and Glob tools available on all platforms.

faq.question: What are the line and complexity limits?
faq.answer: Maximum 180 lines of code per file, maximum 15 cyclomatic complexity per function, maximum 50 lines per function.

faq.question: How do I integrate with pre-commit hooks?
faq.answer: Add ./.claude/skills/quality-reviewer/scripts/full-review.sh to your .husky/pre-commit file to run checks before each commit.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No, this skill only reads and analyzes code. It reports violations but does not make any changes to your files.

faq.question: Why are my imports being flagged?
faq.answer: The skill requires path aliases (@shared/, @modules/, @lib/, @store/) instead of relative imports (../../../) for better maintainability.

faq.question: How is this different from ESLint?
faq.answer: ESLint catches syntax and style issues. This skill enforces project-specific architectural standards like folder structure, file organization, and naming conventions.
